clinical_study.brief_title: ELR Monitoring Against Permanent Pacemaker in Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: Randomised ELR Monitoring Against Permanent Pacemaker in Atrial Fibrillation

brief_summary.textblock: Randomised crossover study comparing the sensitivity and specificity of 5 External loop recorders in detecting pacemaker detected Atrial fibrillation burden.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare the diagnostic accuracy of the ZIO xt , MoMe, TECHNOMED pocket ECG and Nuubo to the R-test, our current standard clinical practice, in detection of AF burden, in patients with history of Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation and have a dual chamber pacemaker or ICD in situ, with sensitivity and specificity of AF detection calculated from the implanted pacemaker monitored beat to beat holters.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity in detection of pacemaker detected AF burden in comparison to R-test
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity of ZIO xt patch, MoMe, TECHNOMED pocket ECG AND Nuubo in detection of pacemaker detected AF burden in comparison to R-test. Sensitivity and sepcificity will be determined by the percentage of pacemaker detected AF episodes that have been detected by each ELR device.

secondary_outcome.measure: proportion of pacemaker detected tachyarrhythmias detected in comparison to R-test
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of pacemaker detected tachyarrhythmias detected by the ZIO xt patch, MoMe, TECHNOMED pocket ECG and Nuubo in comparison to R-test

secondary_outcome.measure: Total wear time in comparison to R-test
secondary_outcome.description: Total wear time of the ZIO xt patch, MoMe, TECHNOMED pocket ECG and Nuubo in comparison to R-test

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of symptomatic arrhythmias detected in comparison to R-test
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of symptoms secondary to arrhythmias detected by the ZIO xt patch, MoMe, TECHNOMED pocket ECG and Nuubo compared to R-Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Cost effectiveness in detection of arrhythmias in comparison to R-test
secondary_outcome.description: Cost-effectiveness of ZIO xt patch, MoMe, TECHNOMED pocket ECG and Nuubo in detection of arrhythmia in comparison to R-Test

other_outcome.measure: User satisfaction in interpretation of reports compare
other_outcome.description: Ease of interpretation of results summary derived by device software - validated by questionnaire provided to junior & senior Cardiologists and junior & senior Physiologists

other_outcome.measure: Participant feedback on device tolerability assessed by Visual Analogue Score (VAS) questionnaire
other_outcome.description: Participant feedback on device tolerability assessed by Visual Analogue Score (VAS) questionnaire

arm_group.description: Single arm study. All participants with existing permanent dual chamber pacemakers will be monitored with 5 different Loop recorder devices for a 2 week period to assess there sensitivity and specificity in detecting AF burden. The devices used will be R test Nuubo TECHNOMED pocket ECG ZIO xt patch MoMe

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- History of Atrial Fibrillation
- Dual chamber pacemaker with advanced holter arrhythmia diagnostics
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous AV node ablation
